text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Zaki a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to decode an
encoded authorization error message for
AWS backup let's get
started sometimes when you perform an
operation in AWS backup you might
receive an encoded authorization error
message the error message is encoded
because the details might contain
sensitive
information before you decode the error
message make sure that you have the SDS
decode authorization message AWS
identity and access management
permission now let me show you how to
decode the error message
run the decode authorization message AWS
CLI command and include the error
message that you
received the commands output shows the
decoded error message in a readable
format for example let's look at this
decoded
output here we can see that the AWS
backup default service role didn't have
the AM pass permission to interact with
the EC2 instance role required for
restoring an instance to resolve this
issue use the IM console to add the
missing permission to the ROS policy so
now you know how to decode an encoded
authorization error message for AWS
backup thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
